intro: Hibbertia monticola, commonly known as the mountain hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and tableland regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruits that are capsules containing numerous seeds. Hibbertia monticola is often found in open forests and heathlands, thriving in well-drained conditions.
